釣り下がる: (つりさがる) - to hang down; to dangle
釣り下げる: (つりさげる) - to suspend from; to be suspended (from)
釣り出す: (つりだす) - to pull out a fish; to lure
釣り台: (つりだい) - fishing stand/small portable stand that can be assembled quickly; stand used to transport people or things (Edo period)
釣り合う: (つりあう) - to balance/to be in harmony/to be in equilibrium; to suit/to go well together/to be a good match
釣り客: (つりきゃく) - visiting angler; fishing visitor
釣り戸棚: (つりとだな) - hanging cupboard; wall cabinet
釣り手: (つりて) - (usu. 吊り手) hanger (e.g. for mosquito net)/hanging strap; (usu. 釣り手) fisherman/angler; (釣り手 only)  lifting hand (judo)
釣り書: (つりしょ) - (esp. for お見合い) family chart and personal history
釣り書き: (つりがき) - (esp. for お見合い) family chart and personal history
釣り柿: (つりがき) - persimmon (hung to dry); dried persimmon
釣り殿: (つりどの) - buildings on the east and west side of the southern pond (in traditional palatial-style architecture)
釣り球: (つりだま) - {baseb} bait pitch; sucker pitch; pitch that lures a batter to swing
釣り花: (つりばな) - flower placement in a hanging vessel
釣り落とした魚は大きい: (つりおとしたさかなはおおきい) - (proverb) the biggest fish is always the one that got away
釣り行灯: (つりあんどん) - hanging paper lantern
釣り込まれる: (つりこまれる) - to be carried away by; to be talked into
釣り込む: (つりこむ) - to take in; to attract
釣り釜: (つりがま) - iron kettle suspended on a chain
釣り銭口: (つりせんぐち) - coin return slot; change slot
釣り鐘: (つりがね) - temple bell; hanging bell; funeral bell
釣り鐘マント: (つりがねマント) - long cloak worn by soldiers, students, etc. (Meiji period)
釣る: (つる) - to fish/to angle/to catch; to lure in/to tempt/to attract/to entice/to allure
釣ランプ: (つりランプ) - droplight; hanging lamp; pendant; pendent lamp; swinging lamp
釣上げ: (つりあげ) - mechanism used to lift an actor onto the stage (in kabuki)
釣上げる: (つりあげる) - to raise/to lift/to hang up/to suspend; to (artificially, deliberately) raise prices; (釣り上げる, 釣上げる only) to pull in (fish)
釣下げる: (つりさげる) - to suspend from; to be suspended (from)
釣台: (つりだい) - fishing stand/small portable stand that can be assembled quickly; stand used to transport people or things (Edo period)
釣合う: (つりあう) - to balance/to be in harmony/to be in equilibrium; to suit/to go well together/to be a good match
釣戸棚: (つりとだな) - hanging cupboard; wall cabinet
釣手: (つりて) - (usu. 吊り手) hanger (e.g. for mosquito net)/hanging strap; (usu. 釣り手) fisherman/angler; (釣り手 only)  lifting hand (judo)
釣書: (つりがき) - (esp. for お見合い) family chart and personal history
釣書き: (つりがき) - (esp. for お見合い) family chart and personal history
釣果: (chouka) - pesca, quantidade de peixes capturados, peixe capturado
釣殿: (つりどの) - buildings on the east and west side of the southern pond (in traditional palatial-style architecture)
釣球: (つりだま) - {baseb} bait pitch; sucker pitch; pitch that lures a batter to swing
釣瓶打ち: (つるべうち) - fire in rapid succession; a volley of shots
釣菌: (ちょうきん) - extracting bacteria (from a petri dish, etc.)
釣虻: (ツリアブ) - bee fly (any insect of family Bombyliidae)
釣行灯: (つりあんどん) - hanging paper lantern
釣込む: (つりこむ) - to take in; to attract
釣釜: (つりがま) - iron kettle suspended on a chain
釣銭口: (つりせんぐち) - coin return slot; change slot
釣鐘: (つりがね) - temple bell; hanging bell; funeral bell
釣鐘マント: (つりがねマント) - long cloak worn by soldiers, students, etc. (Meiji period)
鈍い: (nibui) - dull (ex.: uma faca), blunt; thickheaded, obtuse, stupid , dull (e.g. a knife), blunt; thickheaded, obtuse, stupid; dull (sound, color, etc.), dim (light); slow, sluggish, inert, lethargic
